alert.note: Alert for Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 7:57PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN ROOSEVELT COUNTY THROUGH 830 PM MDT... At 757 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Portales to near Pep. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Portales, Dora, Causey, Milnesand, Lingo, Arch, Pep, Oasis State Park, and Rogers. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
